 'Variations' is a ballet made by New York City Ballet co-founder and founding
 choreographer George Balanchine to Stravinsky's [[Variations
 (Stravinsky)|Variations: Aldous Huxley in memoriam]] (1963â64). The premiere
 took place on Thursday, March 31, 1966, at the New York State Theater, Lincoln
 Center; Balanchine made a new version for City Ballet's 1982 Stravinsky
 Centennial Celebration.
categories: Ballets to the music of Igor Stravinsky
